content.user_title: Manage Quality Documentation for Regulated Industries
content.value_statement: Medical device organizations struggle with complex documentation requirements across multiple regulatory frameworks. This skill provides expert guidance on document control systems, regulatory compliance, and change management processes aligned with ISO 13485, FDA, and EU MDR requirements.
actual_capabilities: Design and implement ISO 13485 compliant document control systems
Oversee regulatory documentation for FDA 510(k), EU MDR, and international submissions
Implement change control workflows with impact assessment and approval processes
Configure electronic document management systems with 21 CFR Part 11 compliance
Manage document lifecycle from creation through retention and disposal
limitations: Does not execute file operations or modify documents directly
Cannot access external regulatory databases or submission portals
Provides guidance only - requires human review for regulatory decisions
Does not replace qualified regulatory affairs professionals

use_cases.title: Build Document Control System
use_cases.description: Design document classification, version control, and approval workflows that meet ISO 13485 and FDA requirements.

use_cases.title: Prepare Submission Documentation
use_cases.description: Organize technical documentation for EU MDR Annex II compliance and FDA 510(k) submission packages.

use_cases.title: Implement Change Management
use_cases.description: Establish change control processes with impact assessment, risk evaluation, and regulatory impact analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Document Control Basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a document control system for our medical device company. We need document classification, numbering conventions, version control procedures, and approval workflows that comply with ISO 13485 Clause 4.2.3 and FDA 21 CFR Part 11.

prompt_templates.title: Regulatory Submission Prep
prompt_templates.scenario: Preparing FDA or EU MDR submission
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me organize our technical documentation for an EU MDR submission. We need to structure Annex II documentation including device description, design information, and clinical evaluation reports.

prompt_templates.title: Change Control Process
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a change control process for our document management system. Include change request initiation, impact assessment, regulatory impact evaluation, approval workflows, and post-change monitoring.

prompt_templates.title: DMS Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me evaluate and implement an electronic document management system for our medical device quality system. Include requirements for 21 CFR Part 11 compliance, electronic signatures, audit trails, and integration with our existing quality management processes.

output_examples.input: Design a document control system for our medical device company that complies with ISO 13485 and FDA requirements.
output: Document Classification: Design documents (inputs, outputs, reviews, verification, validation), Risk Management (ISO 14971 files, reports), Manufacturing (specifications, work instructions), Post-Market (surveillance, CAPA)
Version Control: Major version for significant changes, Minor version for editorial updates, Effective date tracking, Obsolete document archival with retention periods
Approval Workflow: Author creation â†’ Technical review â†’ QA review â†’ Regulatory review â†’ Final approval, Electronic signature capture with 21 CFR Part 11 compliance
Retention Periods: Product life cycle + 2 years, or per jurisdictional requirements (EU: 10 years post-CE mark, FDA: 2 years after device discontinuation)

best_practices: Maintain clear document classification and numbering systems that enable easy retrieval and regulatory traceability
Implement electronic signature controls and audit trails that meet 21 CFR Part 11 requirements for all approval actions
Establish systematic periodic review cycles and change control processes before modifying any regulated document
anti_patterns: Using uncontrolled document versions or storing files in multiple locations without version tracking
Allowing document changes without documented impact assessment and approval workflows
Failing to maintain linkage between design documents, risk management files, and regulatory submissions

faq.question: What regulatory frameworks does this skill cover?
faq.answer: This skill covers ISO 13485, FDA 21 CFR Part 11, EU MDR Annex II and III, FDA 510(k) and PMA submissions, ISO 14971 risk management, and international market requirements including Health Canada and TGA.

faq.question: Can this skill help with FDA 21 CFR Part 11 compliance?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides guidance on electronic signature implementation, audit trail requirements, access controls, and electronic record management aligned with 21 CFR Part 11 requirements.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code or modify files?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based guidance skill. It provides expert advice on documentation processes but does not execute scripts, modify files, or access external systems.

faq.question: How does this skill handle multi-jurisdictional requirements?
faq.answer: The skill provides frameworks for managing documentation across EU MDR, FDA, Health Canada, TGA, and other international markets with guidance on conflicting requirements and harmonization strategies.

faq.question: What is the difference between this and a document management system?
faq.answer: This skill provides expert guidance on designing, implementing, and managing document control processes. It does not replace technical document management systems but advises on their configuration and use.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for software as a medical device companies?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill covers IEC 62304 software lifecycle documentation requirements and can help structure software design documentation, verification reports, and regulatory submissions for SaMD products.
